title: The complex history of Joe Biden's decades-long friendship with Jimmy Carter
shortDescription: Joe Biden may have been the first U.S. senator to endorse Jimmy Carter's presidential bid. But that doesn't mean they always saw eye-to-eye.

title: Trump backs Mike Johnson for House Speaker amid GOP doubts
shortDescription: House lawmakers on Friday are set to vote on the speakership as some Republicans cast doubt on Mike Johnson's leadership.

title: Trump loses sexual abuse appeal in $5 million E. Jean Carroll case
shortDescription: A federal appeals court ruled against President-elect Donald Trump's appeal of a $5 million award to the columnist.

title: Biden praises 'dear friend' Jimmy Carter after the former president's death
shortDescription: President Joe Biden praised his 'dear friend' Jimmy Carter after the former president died at the age of 100 at his Georgia home on Sunday.

title: Donald Trump comments twice on death of former President Jimmy Carter
shortDescription: President-elect Donald Trump commented on the death of Jimmy Carter after the 39th US president died on Sunday at his home in Plains, Georgia.

title: Biden marks Jan. 9 as national day of mourning after Jimmy Carter's death
shortDescription: President Joe Biden marked Jan. 9 as a national day of mourning in honor of the death of former President Jimmy Carter.

title: Biden memorializes 'friend' Jimmy Carter
shortDescription: Jimmy Carter, the 39th president of the United States has died at 100. President Joe Biden delivered remarks on his legacy.

title: Trump, Obama, Bush and Clinton honor fellow ex-president Carter
shortDescription: All four living ex-presidents paid tribute to Jimmy Carter, the longest-living former commander-in-chief in U.S. history who died on Sunday.

title: Joe Biden mourns Jimmy Carter as 'extraordinary leader'
shortDescription: Joe Biden said an official state funeral to be held in Washington D.C. for Jimmy Carter, who died at age 100.

title: Biden calls South Korea plane crash a 'tragedy,' says US ready to provide assistance
shortDescription: President Joe Biden said on Sunday that he was “deeply saddened” by the commercial plane crash in South Korea that killed 179 people.
